instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
Hi Fellows, I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that powers on green and red light, fans happily spinning but no chime. No obvious liquid damage spotted. So far I have checked if 3.42 makes it to the SMC it seems ok (measured 3.49 though). What more should i check?

EDIT: No light on USB mouse

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: CPU V-Core present? Check that and work backwards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
Just for a learning moment; why would you check 3V42 when the board turns on already?

Probably a dead GPU, heat it up and see if it works again, then either battle with Apple to get it fixed under GPU program or replace the GPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: Thanks for the tips, just been doing this for less then a year so many learning moments needed ;). Will try to reflow the GPU see if I can get it working like that. And check CPU V-Core as well. Since it is an 15 inch might very well be the GPU.
